annotation: Shows Amfo'an consonant insertion; regular reflex of PMP *bahi

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect
Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: istri (more respectful than bini), loaned from Sanskrit
Certainly a reflex of *biha (cf. Atoni); the lack of segmentation of the possessive -n has lead to erroneous associated with *binay
same as 'woman' but a possessive is used if it means wife
the v could be an r
the v could be an r
